title: How to Get Free or Discounted Internet Through Federal Programs
seoTitle: Free or Discounted Internet: Federal Programs Guide
summary: Internet access is essential ‚Äî and for qualifying households, it can be free or heavily discounted. This article explains how the Affordable Connectivity Program (ACP) works and how to apply for monthly savings on broadband service.

body.raw:
## Lost the ACP discount? Here‚Äôs how to still get online for less. Federal help didn‚Äôt vanish completely‚Äîuse this guide to line up a replacement discount fast and keep your home connection affordable.

Quick links for , :

  • Apply for free phone service (SafeLink)
  • Apply for SNAP (food assistance)
 ## Quick wins you can try today - **Check for Lifeline eligibility** (income-based or via programs like SNAP/Medicaid). If you qualify, you can apply the discount to home internet or mobile service. - **Call your current ISP and ask for their low-income plan.** Many providers keep $10‚Äì$30 options; ask whether combining with Lifeline is allowed. - **One-per-household rule tip:** If roommates have separate finances, clarify separate ‚Äúhouseholds‚Äù at the address to avoid denials. - **Document now, decide faster:** Keep a single file with ID, address proof, and program participation to speed up verification. - **If you‚Äôre in a Tribal area:** Ask specifically about enhanced benefits and participating providers serving your location. ## After ACP: the programs and workarounds that still lower your bill When ACP ended, the monthly subsidy disappeared‚Äîbut a few levers remain that can meaningfully cut costs. - **Lifeline is ongoing:** A smaller monthly discount remains available and can be applied to internet or bundled service; some carriers let you stack it with low-income plans. - **Provider specials:** ISPs often run regional promos; a quick call to the ‚Äúretentions‚Äù or ‚Äúloyalty‚Äù line can reveal offers not shown online. - **Library & school hotspots:** Many systems lend Wi-Fi hotspots you can keep for weeks‚Äîuse this as a bridge while benefits are processed. - **Equipment hacks:** Modem/router rental fees add up; a one-time purchase can pay for itself within a year. - **Data-cap math:** Track your actual monthly usage; a cheaper tier may fit once you remove rental fees and autopay discounts kick in. ## Address mismatches & one-per-household: how to prevent denials Identity checks and address validation are the biggest reasons applications stall‚Äîfix these before you submit. - **Use the exact USPS address format** (include apartment/unit). Even small differences can trigger duplicated-household flags. - **Shared addresses:** For multi-unit homes or shelters, request an **address exception** form to prove separate households. - **Name consistency:** Match the name on your ID, utility bill, and any eligibility documents to avoid manual reviews. - **Keep a timeline log:** Note submission dates, upload confirmations, and phone calls; reference this if you need escalation. - **If denied:** Ask which data element failed (address, program verification, identity) and correct just that piece‚Äîthen reapply.

## FAQs ### Can I still get a federal discount after ACP ended? Yes, through **Lifeline** if you qualify. You may also find ISP low-income plans and local hotspot lending as a bridge. ### Can roommates each qualify? If you buy and prepare food separately and manage finances independently, you may be separate ‚Äúhouseholds.‚Äù Be ready to document separate units or budgets. ### Does mobile internet count? Lifeline can apply to mobile or home service. If home broadband isn‚Äôt available or is too costly, a mobile plan can be a workable interim option. ### What if my application says there‚Äôs already a benefit at my address? Request an address exception to show separate households (e.g., apartment splits, informal units, or shelters). ---
